source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Boraginaceae

items.item_name: Amsinckia spectabilis (see note after genus description)

leads.lead_text: Sepals 5, but often apparently 4 by total or partial union of the axial pair in at least some flowers; corolla orange, much longer than calyx at anthesis
Sepals 5, free to the base in all flowers; corolla pale yellow or orange, longer than or about as long as calyx at anthesis
Corolla throat constricted and closed by hairy saccate scales; stamens inserted low in corolla-tube
Corolla throat open and glabrous; stamens inserted in corolla throat
Corolla orange or orange-yellow, much longer than calyx at anthesis; stems strigose only, often almost glabrous; mericarps transversely wrinkled
Corolla pale yellow or bright yellow, not or scarcely longer than calyx at anthesis; stems strigose with underlying shorter hairs; mericarps not or only weakly transversely wrinkled
Mericarps 2–2.5 mm long, surface covered with rounded to pointed (but not spine- tipped) tubercles
Mericarps 2.5–3.5 mm long, surface covered with spine-tipped tubercles
